page.title: 01PART OF ROSS AND AREA TO SW
page.content: Ross-on-Wye is a steep streeted town of Georgian Houses, standing on a bend in the river and looking towards the Welsh hills. It is the main tourist centre for the Wye Valley. In the town centre is a 17th century arcaded market hall. Ross traditionally has been a small market town, but in the last decade, or more, there have been considerable housing developments changing it into a dormitory town as the M50 conveniently links it to the motorway network. Traditional farming methods have been superseded by corporate ownership, in many cases, placing the emphasis on cereals, sugar beet and potatoes.
